title: New Horizons
text:
For a while now i have been trying to express my thoughs in a shareable media. I ran around circles trying to figure out which technology should i use, but that was more of an excuse to avoid actually sitting and taking the time to write. Writing is not something that comes naturally to me, but i do think is the ultimate medium to express ideas and share them with others. So this is the start of what i hope would be a nice adventure into my own thoughts and ideas.


Tet’s see if we can add a nice figure to this post.


Show source
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()








Figure 1: A line plot on a polar axis








Now let’s do some math.
\[
\int_0^\infty x^2 dx
\]






Tip



Use single dollar sings $ for inline math \(\frac{1}{2}\)




Some column margin text in here: 
We know from the first fundamental theorem of calculus that for \(x\) in \([a, b]\):
\[\frac{d}{dx}\left( \int_{a}^{x} f(u)\,du\right)=f(x).\]



What if we want the nice graph to be interactive?

import plotly.express as px
import plotly.io as pio
df = px.data.iris()
1fig = px.scatter(df, x="sepal_width", y="sepal_length",
                 color="species",
                 marginal_y="violin", marginal_x="box",
                 trendline="ols", template="simple_white")
fig.show()


1

Example of code line annotations






                                                


Figure 2: An interactive plot








Demonstration of pipe table syntax


Default
Left
Right
Center




12
12
12
12


123
123
123
123


1
1
1
1







import pandas as pd
df = pd.read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/plotly/datasets/master/earthquakes-23k.csv')

import plotly.express as px
fig = px.density_mapbox(df, lat='Latitude', lon='Longitude', z='Magnitude', radius=10,
                        center=dict(lat=0, lon=180), zoom=0,
                        mapbox_style="open-street-map")
fig.show()



                                                


Figure 3: A wide figure

What about some biblioghraphy and cross-references?

Reinforcement Learning Stuff (Montague 1999)
Cross-referencing a figure Figure 2

title: Post With Code
text: This is a post with executable code.

title: Welcome To My Blog
text:
This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!

Since this post doesn’t specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.

title: About
text:
Hi, mi name is Diego Andrés Gómez Polo, a colombian Systems & Computing Engineer and Mathematician from Universidad de los Andes.
Currently a Machine Learning Engineer at Rappi.
This is my personal blog, for anything and everything but mostly AI stuff.
